intro: Heterotropa savatieri, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with upright stems and produces clusters of violet or purple flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial shade, making it a popular houseplant. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to bloom throughout the year under proper care.
